: : Rodimus Prime : :

Rodimus frowns when he learns that the plan has gone wrong.

Rodimus Prime: Glad to know your ok. I'll await your return. Rodimus out.


raccoon7679 <logomorph@...> wrote:
Battera::

She awoke from under the debre.  She sat up and checked her statis. 
She had sustained damage, but was still funtional. She heared her 
commlink going off and opened up the channel. "Rodimus, I am still 
funtional. Please forgive. Something went wrong. Nightlight is no 
longer in my grasp. I will explain later. I will return to the base 
and inform you of the situation."  She then climbed up from the wood 
pile and took to the sky. Her wounds had closed, but they still hurt 
like the pit. She flew in the direction of the maximal base. 



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Rodimus Prime : :
> 
> Rodimus jumped up a bit as the computer informed him of the 
positions and signatures. Something had happened envolving Night 
Light, and Battera seemed to be in trouble.
> 
> Rodimus opens a commlink to Battera.
> 
> Rodimus Prime: Rodimus to Battera. What's the status of your 
mission and do you require assistance?
> 
> 
> airly2000 <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Elita:
> 
> Elita woke up and yawed. Without warning she hit several buttons 
> that changed the location of the main screen and now showed a 
groups 
> of bots. 
> 
> "Group of bots of diferents  are located at coordinates 1-89-03... 
> firm of energies, comfirmed: Maxima, aliance Predacon, Unknow bot, 
> alliange Unknow... Unknow bot, alliance not comfirmed, firm of 
> energy downloaded in order to do a major reseach... The last robot 
> has Predacon program but the firm of energy it's equal with the 
> Maximal named Night..."
> 
> Elita hit the same buttons once more time and the coordinates 
> changed again, and now a screen showed that a Predacon signature in 
> the no-manland that are reveral miles far of Maximal's Base 
> (Batera). 
> 
> Elita was laughting a lot, that was such fun, and she attemped to 
> push the nutton once more time.
> 
>
